intro: Selaginella hartwegiana var. leptoblepharis, commonly known as the narrow-leaf spikemoss, is a species of spikemoss native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, needle-like leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky crevices. It has a creeping rhizome that produces upright, branching stems. Its reproductive structures, including strobila, are small and borne on the upper part of the stems.
